Cengage Magma: Forms

04Forms

The goal of Magma Forms is to build a pattern library that enables everyone to easily build forms consistent with Cengage's design patterns that will work responsively across devices.

You can also view the Magma Framework Documentation for help using Magma Forms in your project

Basic Example

<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="input-text">Enter some text</label>
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input"> </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="select">Select a number</label>
      <select name="select" id="select-validation" class="cenform-control">
        <option value="">Select</option>
        <option value="1">1</option>
        <option value="2">2</option>
        <option value="3">3</option>
        <option value="4">4</option>
        <option value="5">5</option>
      </select>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="textarea">Write some text</label>
      <textarea class="cenform-control" rows="3" placeholder="Text Area"></textarea>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-submit align-right">
      <button class="btn btn-success">Submit</button>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

This example will demonstrate how to properly assemble all of the required HTML to display a form consisting of the three basic elements of an input, select and textarea, along with a submit button.

If you're familiar with how Bootstrap asembles its forms, this example should be very easy. We optionally use the <form> tag which may not necessary if you're using a JavaScript library or framework in your application but is consistent with properly formatted HTML. We also use the <fieldset> tag in order facilitate the use of assistive technology. Neither tag is associated with Magma styling and will notbe visible in the display.

Secondly, we wrap our form elements in a div or other similar tag using the .cenform-group class, which is very similar to the .form-group class you would see in Bootstrap. This will apply all of the neccessary styles to its child elements and can also be used to asign validation and visibility states.

Finally, we apply the .cenform-control class to our form elements in order to style them according to the Magma style guide. Again, this is very similar to the .form-control class you'll find in Bootstrap.

The .cenform-control class should be added to all input, select and textarea form elements to syle them properly. The label tag does not need the .cenform-control class as it inherits its styles from the parent .cenform-group element and appear hidden by default.

Our submit buttons can be configured in a variety of ways, with the default being represented by a simple button, right aligned, directly after the last form element. To achieve this result, we create a .cenform-submit element, designate the alignment we want with the .align-right class and insert the button markup with the appropriate classes, in this case .btn and .btn-success.

Medium Example

Forget? 
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="Text-Input-Inline"></label>
          <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input Inline" id="Text-Input-Inline"> </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-md-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="Select-Example"></label>
          <select class="cenform-control" name="" id="Select-Example">
            <option value="">Select</option>
            <option value="1">1</option>
            <option value="2">2</option>
            <option value="3">3</option>
            <option value="4">4</option>
            <option value="5">5</option>
          </select>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="Text-Input-Optional">Optional Text Input</label>
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input (optional)" id="Text-Input-Optional"> </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="basic-addon1">Text Input with Icon</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <div class="input-group-addon icon-form-addon">
          <span class="icon icon-envelope"></span>
        </div>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input with Icon" aria-describedby="basic-addon1"> </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="Text-Input-Icon">Text Input with icon and Help Link</label>
      <div class="input-group forget-group">
        <div class="input-group-addon icon-form-addon">
          <span class="icon icon-key3"></span>
        </div>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" id="Text-Input-Icon" placeholder="Text Input with Icon and Help Link" maxlength="17">
        <a class="andesite-forget" href="#">Forget?</a>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="Text-Input-Button">Button Example Right</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input with Button" id="Text-Input-Button">
        <span class="input-group-btn">
          <button class="btn btn-success" type="button">Button</button>
        </span>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="Example-Textarea"></label>
      <textarea class="cenform-control" rows="3" placeholder="Text Area" id="Example-Textarea"></textarea>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-submit align-right">
      <button class="btn btn-success">Submit</button>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

This example will demonstrate how to properly assemble all of the required HTML to display a form consisting of the three basic elements of an input, select and textarea, along with a submit button.

Complex Example

<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="input-text">Enter some text</label>
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input"> </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="select">Select a number</label>
      <select name="select" id="select-validation" class="cenform-control">
        <option value="">Select</option>
        <option value="1">1</option>
        <option value="2">2</option>
        <option value="3">3</option>
        <option value="4">4</option>
        <option value="5">5</option>
      </select>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="textarea">Write some text</label>
      <textarea class="cenform-control" rows="3" placeholder="Text Area"></textarea>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-submit align-right">
      <button class="btn btn-success">Submit</button>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

This example will demonstrate how to properly assemble all of the required HTML to display a form consisting of the three basic elements of an input, select and textarea, along with a submit button.

Supported Controls

Examples of standard form controls supported in an example form layout.

Inputs
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input Example"> </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Most common form control, text-based input fields. Includes support for all HTML5 types: text, password, datetime, datetime-local, date, month, time, week, number, email, url, search, tel, and color.

Inputs will only be fully styled if their type is properly declared.

Textarea
<form action="">
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <textarea name="" id="" cols="30" rows="3" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Textarea Example"></textarea>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Form control which supports multiple lines of text. Change rows attribute as necessary. You must add resize: none; in your CSS if you do not wish the user to resize their textarea.

Checkboxes and Radios
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="checkbox">
      <label>
        <input type="checkbox" value=""> Option one is this and that&mdash;be sure to include why it's great </label>
    </div>
    <div class="checkbox disabled">
      <label>
        <input type="checkbox" value="" disabled> Option two is disabled </label>
    </div>
    <div class="radio">
      <label>
        <input type="radio" name="optionsRadios" id="optionsRadios1" value="option1" checked> Option one is this and that&mdash;be sure to include why it's great </label>
    </div>
    <div class="radio">
      <label>
        <input type="radio" name="optionsRadios" id="optionsRadios2" value="option2"> Option two can be something else and selecting it will deselect option one </label>
    </div>
    <div class="radio disabled">
      <label>
        <input type="radio" name="optionsRadios" id="optionsRadios3" value="option3" disabled> Option three is disabled </label>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Checkboxes are for selecting one or several options in a list, while radios are for selecting one option from many.

Disabled checkboxes and radios are supported, but to provide a "not-allowed" cursor on hover of the parent <label>, you'll need to add the .disabled class to the parent .radio, .radio-inline, .checkbox, or .checkbox-inline.

Selects
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <select class="cenform-control">
        <option>1</option>
        <option>2</option>
        <option>3</option>
        <option>4</option>
        <option>5</option>
      </select>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Note that many native select menus—namely in Safari and Chrome—have rounded corners that cannot be modified via border-radius properties. 

<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <select multiple class="form-control">
        <option>1</option>
        <option>2</option>
        <option>3</option>
        <option>4</option>
        <option>5</option>
      </select>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

For <select> controls with the multiple attribute, multiple options are shown by default.

Static Controls

email@example.com

<form>
  <div class="cenform-group">
    <div class="row">
      <label class="col-sm-2 control-label">Email</label>
      <div class="col-sm-10">
        <p class="cenform-control-static">email@example.com</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <div class="cenform-group">
    <div class="row">
      <label for="inputPassword" class="col-sm-2 control-label">Password</label>
      <div class="col-sm-10">
        <input type="password" class="cenform-control" id="inputPassword" placeholder="Password"> </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</form>

 

When you need to place plain text next to a form label within a form, use the .cenform-control-static class on a <p>.

Input Groups

Extend form controls by adding text or buttons before, after, or on both sides of any text-based <input>. Use .input-group with an .input-group-addon or .input-group-btn to prepend or append elements to a single .cenform-control.

Tooltips & popovers in input groups require special setting
When using tooltips or popovers on elements within an .input-group, you'll have to specify the option container: 'body' to avoid unwanted side effects (such as the element growing wider and/or losing its rounded corners when the tooltip or popover is triggered).

Don't mix with other components
Do not mix form groups or grid column classes directly with input groups. Instead, nest the input group inside of the form group or grid-related element.

Always add labels
Screen readers will have trouble with your forms if you don't include a label for every input. For these input groups, ensure that any additional label or functionality is conveyed to assistive technologies.

The exact technique to be used (visible <label> elements, <label> elements hidden using the .sr-only class, or use of the aria-label, aria-labelledby, aria-describedby, title or placeholder attribute) and what additional information will need to be conveyed will vary depending on the exact type of interface widget you're implementing. The examples in this section provide a few suggested, case-specific approaches.

Basic Example
@
@example.com
$ .00
https://example.com/users/ 
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="basic-addon1">Please enter your Username</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <span class="input-group-addon" id="basic-addon1">@</span>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="basic-addon1"> </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="basic-addon2">Please enter your Username</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Recipient's username" aria-describedby="basic-addon2">
        <span class="input-group-addon" id="basic-addon2">@example.com</span>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="basic-addon3">Please enter a $US amount</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <span class="input-group-addon">$</span>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" aria-label="Amount (to the nearest dollar)" id="basic-addon3">
        <span class="input-group-addon">.00</span>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="basic-url">Enter your vanity URL</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <span class="input-group-addon" id="basic-addon3">https://example.com/users/</span>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" id="basic-url" aria-describedby="basic-addon3"> </div>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Place one add-on or button on either side of an input. You may also place one on both sides of an input.

We do not support multiple add-ons (.input-group-addon or .input-group-btn) on a single side.

We do not support multiple cenform-controls in a single input group.

Sizing
@
@
@ 
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="sizing-addon1">Please enter your Username</label>
      <div class="input-group input-group-lg">
        <span class="input-group-addon" id="sizing-addon1">@</span>
        <input type="text" class="form-control" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="sizing-addon1"> </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="sizing-addon2">Please enter your Username</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <span class="input-group-addon" id="sizing-addon2">@</span>
        <input type="text" class="form-control" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="sizing-addon2"> </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="sizing-addon3">Please enter your Username</label>
      <div class="input-group input-group-sm">
        <span class="input-group-addon" id="sizing-addon3">@</span>
        <input type="text" class="form-control" placeholder="Username" aria-describedby="sizing-addon3"> </div>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Add the relative form sizing classes to the .input-group itself and contents within will automatically resize—no need for repeating the form control size classes on each element.

Checkboxes and radio addons
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="checkbox-example">Checkbox Example</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <span class="input-group-addon">
              <input type="checkbox" aria-label="..."> </span>
            <input type="text" class="form-control" aria-label="..." id="checkbox-example"> </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="radio-example">Radio Example</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <span class="input-group-addon">
              <input type="radio" aria-label="..."> </span>
            <input type="text" class="form-control" aria-label="..." id="radio-example"> </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Place any checkbox or radio option within an input group's addon instead of text.

Button addons
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="button-example-left">Button Example Left</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <span class="input-group-btn">
              <button class="btn btn-success" type="button">Go!</button>
            </span>
            <input type="text" class="form-control" placeholder="Search for..." id="button-example-left"> </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="button-example-right">Button Example Right</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <input type="text" class="form-control" placeholder="Search for..." id="button-example-right">
            <span class="input-group-btn">
              <button class="btn btn-success" type="button">Go!</button>
            </span>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Buttons in input groups are a bit different and require one extra level of nesting. Instead of .input-group-addon, you'll need to use .input-group-btn to wrap the buttons. This is required due to default browser styles that cannot be overridden.

Buttons with dropdowns
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="button-example-left">Button Example Left</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <div class="input-group-btn">
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-haspopup="true" aria-expanded="false">Action
                <span class="caret"></span>
              </button>
              <ul class="dropdown-menu">
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Action</a>
                </li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Another action</a>
                </li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Something else here</a>
                </li>
                <li role="separator" class="divider"></li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Separated link</a>
                </li>
              </ul>
            </div>
            <!-- /btn-group -->
            <input type="text" class="form-control" aria-label="..."> </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="button-example-left">Button Example Right</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <input type="text" class="form-control" aria-label="...">
            <div class="input-group-btn">
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-haspopup="true" aria-expanded="false">Action
                <span class="caret"></span>
              </button>
              <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right">
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Action</a>
                </li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Another action</a>
                </li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Something else here</a>
                </li>
                <li role="separator" class="divider"></li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Separated link</a>
                </li>
              </ul>
            </div>
            <!-- /btn-group -->
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Segmented buttons
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
  • Action
  • Another action
  • Something else here
  • Separated link
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="button-example-left">Button Example Left</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <div class="input-group-btn">
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success">Action</button>
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-haspopup="true" aria-expanded="false">
                <span class="caret"></span>
              </button>
              <ul class="dropdown-menu">
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Action</a>
                </li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Another action</a>
                </li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Something else here</a>
                </li>
                <li role="separator" class="divider"></li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Separated link</a>
                </li>
              </ul>
            </div>
            <!-- /btn-group -->
            <input type="text" class="form-control" aria-label="..."> </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="button-example-left">Button Example Right</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <input type="text" class="form-control" aria-label="...">
            <div class="input-group-btn">
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success">Action</button>
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="dropdown" aria-haspopup="true" aria-expanded="false">
                <span class="caret"></span>
              </button>
              <ul class="dropdown-menu dropdown-menu-right">
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Action</a>
                </li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Another action</a>
                </li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Something else here</a>
                </li>
                <li role="separator" class="divider"></li>
                <li>
                  <a href="#">Separated link</a>
                </li>
              </ul>
            </div>
            <!-- /btn-group -->
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Multiple buttons
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="button-example-left">Button Example Left</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <div class="input-group-btn">
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success">@</button>
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success" aria-label="Bold">$</button>
            </div>
            <!-- /btn-group -->
            <input type="text" class="form-control" aria-label="..."> </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-sm-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="button-example-left">Button Example Right</label>
          <div class="input-group">
            <input type="text" class="form-control" aria-label="...">
            <div class="input-group-btn">
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success">@</button>
              <button type="button" class="btn btn-success">$</button>
            </div>
            <!-- /btn-group -->
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

While you can only have one add-on per side, you can have multiple buttons inside a single .input-group-btn.

Focus State

Forget? 
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="Text-Input-Inline"></label>
          <input type="text" class="cenform-control andesite-focused" placeholder="Text Input Inline" id="Text-Input-Inline"> </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-md-6">
        <div class="cenform-group">
          <label for="Select-Example"></label>
          <select class="cenform-control andesite-focused" name="" id="Select-Example">
            <option value="">Select</option>
            <option value="1">1</option>
            <option value="2">2</option>
            <option value="3">3</option>
            <option value="4">4</option>
            <option value="5">5</option>
          </select>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="Text-Input-Optional">Optional Text Input</label>
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control andesite-focused" placeholder="Text Input (optional)" id="Text-Input-Optional"> </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="basic-addon1">Text Input with Icon</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <div class="input-group-addon icon-form-addon">
          <span class="icon icon-envelope"></span>
        </div>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control andesite-focused" placeholder="Text Input with Icon" aria-describedby="basic-addon1"> </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="Text-Input-Icon">Text Input with icon and Help Link</label>
      <div class="input-group forget-group">
        <div class="input-group-addon icon-form-addon">
          <span class="icon icon-key3"></span>
        </div>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control andesite-focused" id="Text-Input-Icon" placeholder="Text Input with Icon and Help Link" maxlength="17">
        <a class="andesite-forget" href="#">Forget?</a>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="Text-Input-Button">Button Example Right</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control andesite-focused" placeholder="Text Input with Button" id="Text-Input-Button">
        <span class="input-group-btn">
          <button class="btn btn-success" type="button">Button</button>
        </span>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="Example-Textarea"></label>
      <textarea class="cenform-control andesite-focused" rows="3" placeholder="Text Area" id="Example-Textarea"></textarea>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-submit align-right">
      <button class="btn btn-success">Submit</button>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

We remove the default outline styles on some form controls and apply a box-shadow in its place for :focus.

Demo :focus state
The example input uses custom styles in our documentation to demonstrate the :focus state on a .cenform-control.

Disabled State

<form>
  <fieldset disabled>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="disabledTextInput">Disabled input</label>
      <input type="text" id="disabledTextInput" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Disabled input">
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="disabledSelect">Disabled select menu</label>
      <select id="disabledSelect" class="cenform-control">
        <option>Disabled select</option>
      </select>
    </div>
    <div class="checkbox">
      <label>
        <input type="checkbox"> Can't check this </label>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-submit align-right">
      <button class="btn btn-success">Submit</button>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Add the disabled attribute to a <fieldset> to disable all the controls within the <fieldset> at once.

Caveat about link functionality of <a>
By default, browsers will treat all native form controls (<input>, <select> and <button> elements) inside a <fieldset disabled> as disabled, preventing both keyboard and mouse interactions on them. However, if your form also includes <a ... class="btn btn-*"> elements, these will only be given a style of pointer-events: none. As noted in the section about disabled state for buttons (and specifically in the sub-section for anchor elements), this CSS property is not yet standardized and isn't fully supported in Opera 18 and below, or in Internet Explorer 11, and won't prevent keyboard users from being able to focus or activate these links. So to be safe, use custom JavaScript to disable such links.

Cross-browser compatibility
While Bootstrap will apply these styles in all browsers, Internet Explorer 11 and below don't fully support the disabled attribute on a <fieldset>. Use custom JavaScript to disable the fieldset in these browsers.

Readonly State

<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <input class="cenform-control" type="text" placeholder="Readonly input here…" readonly>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Add the readonly boolean attribute on an input to prevent modification of the input's value. Read-only inputs appear lighter (just like disabled inputs), but retain the standard cursor.

Help Text

A block of help text that breaks onto a new line and may extend beyond one line.
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input with Help Text" aria-describedby="helpBlock">
      <div id="helpBlock" class="help-block">A block of help text that breaks onto a new line and may extend beyond one line.</div>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

Help text should be explicitly associated with the form control it relates to using the aria-describedby attribute. This will ensure that assistive technologies – such as screen readers – will announce this help text when the user focuses or enters the control.

Validtion States

Forget? 
<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-md-6 col-xs-12">
        <div class="cenform-group has-error">
          <label for="Text-Input-Inline">Text Input Required</label>
          <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input Inline" id="Text-Input-Inline"> </div>
      </div>
      <div class="col-md-6 col-xs-12">
        <div class="cenform-group has-error">
          <label for="Select-Example">Selection Required</label>
          <select class="cenform-control" name="" id="Select-Example">
            <option value="">Select</option>
            <option value="1">1</option>
            <option value="2">2</option>
            <option value="3">3</option>
            <option value="4">4</option>
            <option value="5">5</option>
          </select>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label class="sr-only" for="Text-Input-Optional">Optional Text Input</label>
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input (optional)" id="Text-Input-Optional"> </div>
    <div class="cenform-group has-error">
      <label for="basic-addon1">Text Input Required</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <div class="input-group-addon icon-form-addon">
          <span class="icon icon-envelope"></span>
        </div>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input with Icon" aria-describedby="basic-addon1"> </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group has-error">
      <label for="Text-Input-Icon">Text Input Required</label>
      <div class="input-group forget-group">
        <div class="input-group-addon icon-form-addon">
          <span class="icon icon-key3"></span>
        </div>
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" id="Text-Input-Icon" placeholder="Text Input with Icon and Help Link" maxlength="17">
        <a class="andesite-forget" href="#">Forget?</a>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group has-error">
      <label for="Text-Input-Button">Text Input Required</label>
      <div class="input-group">
        <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Text Input with Button" id="Text-Input-Button">
        <span class="input-group-btn">
          <button class="btn btn-success" type="button">Button</button>
        </span>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group has-error">
      <label for="Example-Textarea">Text Area Required</label>
      <textarea class="cenform-control" rows="3" placeholder="Text Area" id="Example-Textarea"></textarea>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-submit align-right">
      <button class="btn btn-success">Submit</button>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

These examples will demonstrate the proper validation state and code the code required to produce them.

Control Sizing

<form>
  <fieldset>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control input-lg" placeholder=".input-lg"> </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control" placeholder="Default size"> </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <input type="text" class="cenform-control input-sm" placeholder=".input-sm"> </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="select">Select a number</label>
      <select name="select" id="select-validation" class="cenform-control input-lg">
        <option value="">Select Large</option>
        <option value="1">1</option>
      </select>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="select">Select a number</label>
      <select name="select" id="select-validation" class="cenform-control">
        <option value="">Select Default</option>
        <option value="1">1</option>
      </select>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-group">
      <label for="select">Select a number</label>
      <select name="select" id="select-validation" class="cenform-control input-sm">
        <option value="">Select Small</option>
        <option value="1">1</option>
      </select>
    </div>
    <div class="cenform-submit space-between">
      <button class="btn btn-success btn-lg">Submit Large</button>
      <button class="btn btn-success">Submit Default</button>
      <button class="btn btn-success btn-sm">Submit Small</button>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

 

We can set the height of our form elements by applying the .input-lg for larger or .input-sm classes for smaller elements. Accordingly, we can also adjust the size of our buttons to match the form elements.
